ACTED, Convergences and its partners, supported by the SEI Asia’s Strategic Collaborative Fund, organised the 3Zero Southeast Asia Forum in Manila and online, to promote a sustainable and inclusive agriculture system in Southeast Asia, in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei and the Philippines. This meeting of committed actors in this sector gathered around 500 participants.

The 3Zero Southeast Asia Forum aims to be a platform for dialogue, network and advocacy among all stakeholders involved in the development of sustainable and inclusive agriculture systems and value-chains in Southeast Asia.

The Forum included sessions in different dynamic formats to enable participants to collaboratively identify concrete solutions for the achievement of the overall objective and highlight key learnings and recommendations to feed into public policies in the region and nationally. It also included a fair with booths from structures representing the agriculture sector in the region.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”section” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”46px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

excerpt.rendered: ACTED, Convergences and its partners, supported by the SEI Asia’s Strategic Collaborative Fund, organised the 3Zero Southeast Asia Forum in Manila and online, to promote a sustainable and inclusive agriculture system in Southeast Asia, in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei and the Philippines. This meeting of committed actors in this sector gathered around 500 participants. The 3Zero Southeast Asia Forum aims to be a platform for dialogue, network and […]
